oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Putting it All Together: Udder Health Programs in Private Practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Moslock-Carter, Brenda
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: veterinary technicians
udder health
microbiological testing
teat-end
data management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Veterinary technicians (LVTs) can play a large role in the implementation of successful udder health programs in private practice. In addition to performing microbiological testing, LVTs can gather on-farm data necessary to evaluate and/or monitor key factors that influence udder health, such as teat-end scoring, hygiene scoring, and parlor performance (i.e. prep routine, timing, and equipment function). Recent software developments have made it possible to seamlessly export culture results directly into DairyComp305Â®, enhancing the ability to monitor pathogens at both the individual cow and herd levels.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2011; 129-130
